channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024030638
item.description:
Report X-2024030638

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD DOOR FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND SPILL CART. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER BEGAN CLEANING UP THE SPILL. DURING THE RESPONSE, RESPONDER DISCOVERED A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT TO BE CONTAMINATED BY THE LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON BRINGING THE LEAKING PACKAGE, CONTAMINATED DEBRIS, AND SOILED PACKAGES BACK TO THE DMP CAGE, THE HAZMAT'S INNER CONTAINERS HAD BEEN DISCOVERED TO BE SOILED BY THE LEAKER, AS WELL AS THE OUTER PACKAGING, AND NEEDED TO BE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024030478
item.description:
Report X-2024030478

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the B Wing and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: One of the four containers of Nu-Brite developed a loose cap which allowed a leak to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Haz cage on the Corrosive Pallet.

item.title: Report X-2024030596
item.description:
Report X-2024030596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN THE TRAILER IN THE UNLOAD. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPORPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON ONE OF THE INNER 3.8 LITER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 2 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON.

item.title: Report X-2024030322
item.description:
Report X-2024030322

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the 1-3-5 Unload and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: One of the four bottles of muriatic acid developed splitting at the base of its container allowing it to spill partial contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Ther package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the Corrosive Pallet.
